Description: Ostracon, section of the body of a buff-coloured pottery jar, with indentation indicating the position of one handle, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip, now much darkened, and very faint traces of one line of black-painted hieratic text.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:30-31 House T36.45 I.9
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393620) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393620)
